alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:26PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM PST, emergency management reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalinga and Spanish Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
